intro: Psychotria pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Psychotria pubiflora is also noted for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential pharmacological applications.
